alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook; Northern Penobscot; Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 6:20PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Aroostook and north central Penobscot Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 619 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mars Hill to 7 miles south of Scopan to 9 miles northwest of Shin Pond. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Presque Isle, Fort Fairfield, Mars Hill, Ashland, Easton, Bridgewater, Smyrna, Masardis, Oxbow, Dudley Township, Scopan, Littleton, Monticello, Blaine, Westfield, Chapman, Merrill, Dudley, Scopan Lake and Squa Pan. This includes the following highways... US Highway 1 between Monticello and Mars Hill. State Highway 11 between Knowles Corner and Squapan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northern and east central Maine.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Aroostook; Northern Penobscot; Southeast Aroostook
